meanings.definition: The action of withholding possession of property from the rightful owner.
meanings.sent1: The deforcement of the house caused legal issues for the family.
meanings.sent2: The deforcement of the land led to a long court battle.
meanings.sent3: The deforcement of the keys resulted in a comical search around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her deforcement of the treasure chest symbolized her determination to keep it hidden.
meanings.sent5: The deforcement of the car keys made him late for work.

meanings.definition: The act of forcibly keeping someone out of their rightful property.
meanings.sent1: The deforcement of the gate prevented him from entering the garden.
meanings.sent2: His deforcement of the safe made it impossible for anyone to access it.
meanings.sent3: The deforcement of the cookie jar led to a playful chase around the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her deforcement of the diary hinted at hidden secrets within its pages.
meanings.sent5: The deforcement of the entrance gate left them stranded outside.

meanings.definition: The wrongful withholding of possession of property from the rightful owner.
meanings.sent1: The deforcement of the inheritance caused family disputes.
meanings.sent2: Their deforcement of the documents delayed the transaction.
meanings.sent3: The deforcement of the remote control led to a humorous search under the couch cushions.
meanings.sent4: His deforcement of the spotlight stole the attention from the rightful performer.
meanings.sent5: The deforcement of the painting left the true artist unrecognized.
